permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Activates a loyalty program.

When a loyalty program is installed it starts in `"DRAFT"` status. Customers cannot earn or redeem points while the program is not `"ACTIVE"`.

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary: Retrieves the loyalty program.

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Updates the loyalty program.

You cannot activate the loyalty program using this endpoint. To do so, use the [Activate Loyalty Program endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/program/activate-loyalty-program).

examples.title: Update loyalty program

docs.summary: Triggered when a loyalty program is updated.

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
A loyalty program allows sites to maintain customer reward accounts. Site owners can create a
loyalty program to increase customer retention. Read more about the loyalty program in
[this overview](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-loyalty-program-an-overview).

members.name: name
members.doc: Program name.

members.name: pointDefinition
members.doc: Details about the program's collectible unit.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Program status. Customers can only earn or redeem points while the program is `"ACTIVE"`.

Default: `"DRAFT"`

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the program was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the program was updated.

members.name: isPremium
members.doc: Set to true if user has required plan to activate program

members.name: pointsExpiration
members.doc: Points expiration configuration

members.name: premiumFeatures
members.doc: Information about available premium features

members.name: customName
members.doc:
Display name for the program's collectible unit. It's recommended to use the plural, for example
`"Stars"`. In contrast to a custom name, the default `"Points"` name is translated and adjusted to singular based
on circumstances.

Default: `"Points"`

Max: 20 characters

members.name: icon
members.doc: Details about the points icon.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of points expiration feature

members.name: monthsOfInactivity
members.doc: Expire points after set months of inactivity

members.name: expiringPointsPercentage
members.doc: Percentage of points expiring

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Set to true if user has loyalty program premium feature

members.name: tiers
members.doc: Set to true if user has tiers premium feature

members.name: pointsExpiration
members.doc: Set to true if user has points expiration premium feature

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

docs.summary:
Hard deletion of the meta site.

Could not be restored. Therefore it's desirable to cleanup data.
Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.
Restoration of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.
Site transferred to another user.

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: appDefId

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Not only UUID. Something here could be something weird.

docs.summary: Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.
Assigned Studio editor
Unassigned Studio editor

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

docs.summary:
A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).
  A boolean feature is similar to a quantitive feature with a default limit of 0 and UNLIMITED premium limit (although a bit simplified).
A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Default (or Freemium) quota limitation. if left undefined the free feature has unlimited amount.

members.name: period
members.doc: Periodic time-frame to reset the usage counter. You may use NO_PERIOD if counter shouldn't be reset.

members.name: units
members.doc: Usage measurement units (seconds? MBs? unitless?). Usage reported will be counted in multiples of this basic unit.

docs.summary:
Context this feature is currently connected to.
Note: Do not confuse with feature scope which is configured in the product catalog
and defines in which context the product can be used

members.name: userId
members.doc:
ID of the Wix account that the feature instance belongs to.
Available for both site and account level feature instances.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc:
ID of the meta site that the feature instance is assigned to.
Only available for site level feature instances that are assigned to a Wix
site. Not available for account level and unassigned site level feature
instances.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.
Metadata of the feature. Wix Premium uses the metadata object to indicate
that customers who purchase a product with the feature also get
access to an additional product. For these bundled products `metadata`
looks like this: `{"tpa": "{"appDefId": "sample-app-def-id-1234567890", "vendorProductId": "sample-productId"}}"`.
But you can use the `metadata` property for other purposes, too.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: id
members.doc:
ID of the feature. __Note:__ Isn't unique. For example, all features that
are available to free Wix accounts or site in some capacity have
`{"id": "DEFAULT"}`. Use `uniqueName` as unique identifier for a feature.

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
Unique name of the feature. Only lower case letters, numbers, and dashes 
`-` are supported. Used in the endpoints of the 
[Features Manager API](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/introduction) 
to specify the feature. Not visible to customers. We recommend to start 
the unique name with a prefix describing your organization or Wix company. 
For example, `bookings` or `crm`.

Min: 2 characters  
Max: 50 characters

members.name: context
members.doc:
Information about whether the feature belongs to a Wix account or site. 
Account features have `context.userId`. Site features have `context.metaSiteId` in case 
they're assigned to a specific site. Site features that aren't assigned to 
a specific site have neither ID.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Deprecated.

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc: Deprecated.

members.name: quantityInfo
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `quotaInfo` and `enabled` instead.

members.name: quotaInfo
members.doc:
Information about how often customers can use the feature during a specific
period. Available only for quota features.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the customer is currently allowed to use the feature. 
`true` means that the customer can use the feature. This means a boolean 
feature is active or a quota feature has remaining usage.  
`false` means that the customer can't use the feature. 
This means a boolean feature isn't active or a quota feature doesn't 
have remaining usage.

members.name: subscriptionId
members.doc:
ID of the [subscription](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/subscription-object) 
to which the feature instance belongs.

members.name: metadata
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Metadata of the feature. Wix Premium uses the metadata object to indicate
that customers who purchase a product with the feature also get
access to an additional product. For these bundled products `metadata`
looks like this: `{"tpa": "{"appDefId": "sample-app-def-id-1234567890", "vendorProductId": "sample-productId"}}"`.
But you can use the `metadata` property for other purposes, too.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `enabled` instead.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `quotaInfo` instead.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
How often the customer is allowed to use the feature during the specified 
period. `null` means that the customer has unlimited access to the feature.

members.name: period
members.doc:
Time frame for the usage limitation. `NO_PERIOD` means that `remainingUsage` 
isn't automatically reset to the feature's `limit` after a specific period. 
You may still manually call 
[Reset Usage Counter](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/reset-usage-counter).

members.name: currentUsage
members.doc:
How often the customer has used the feature during the current 
period.

members.name: remainingUsage
members.doc:
How often the customer can still use the feature during the current 
period. `null` means that the customer has unlimited access to the feature.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
Timestamp of the event in 
[UTC time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that makes a feature eligible to the user. 
Triggered for example, for new features or when a feature is reassigned 
to an account or a site.

members.name: disabled
members.doc:
Information about an event that disables a feature for the user. 
Triggered for example, when a feature is unassigned from a site, 
reassigned to a different site, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: updated
members.doc:
Information about an event that updates a feature. An `updated` event 
is triggered for example by the 
[Report Quota Usage](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/report-quota-usage) 
and [Reset Usage Counter](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-features-manager/reset-usage-counter) 
endpoints.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc:
Information about an event that cancels a feature for the user. 
Triggered for example, when a feature is canceled, transferred to
another account, or the user switched to a different contract.

members.name: feature
members.doc: Enabled feature.

members.name: transferredFromAccount
members.doc:
Information about a transfer from another account. 
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.transferred_from_another_account` instead.

members.name: reassignedFromMetasite
members.doc:
Information about a transfer from another site. 
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.reassigned_from_site` instead.

members.name: transferredFromAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another account.

members.name: reassignedFromSite
members.doc: Information about a transfer from another site.

members.name: assignedFromFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that hadn't been assigned to site.

members.name: newFeature
members.doc: Information about the new feature.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: manualFeatureCreation
members.doc: Information about the manually created features.

members.name: migratedFromLegacy
members.doc: Information about a feature that was migrated from legacy.

members.name: feature
members.doc: Canceled feature.

members.name: transferredToAccount
members.doc:
Information about a transfer to the account. 
__Deprecated__. Use `reason.transferred_to_account` instead.

members.name: transferredToAnotherAccount
members.doc: Information about a transfer to the account.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: cancelRequest
members.doc: Information about the feature cancellation.

members.name: feature
members.doc:
Disabled feature. Includes information about the feature's new state, 
possibly its new context.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: ID of the meta site for which the feature has been disabled.

members.name: unassingedToFloating
members.doc: Information about a feature that's no longer assigned to a site.

members.name: replacedByAnotherSubscription
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been replaced by a feature from a 
different subscription.

members.name: reassignedToAnotherSite
members.doc:
Information about a feature that's been reassigned to a different 
site.

members.name: feature
members.doc:
Updated feature. Includes information about the feature's new state and 
possibly its new context.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that doesn't have a usage quota.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc: Information about a feature that has a usage quota.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc: Information about the contract switch.

members.name: pointsExpirationChanges
members.doc: Points expiration configuration changes

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DRAFT - initial program status (program was created but was not enabled yet)
  • ACTIVE - program is active
  • PAUSED - program was manually disabled by the user (this action can be reverted, meaning user can set it to be active again)

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_STATUS
  • DISABLED - Points expiration feature is disabled
  • ENABLED - Points expiration feature is enabled

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ENABLED
  • DISABLED
  • PENDING
  • DEMO

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • TRASH
  • DELETED
  • PENDING_PURGE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_NAMESPACE
  • WIX - Default namespace for UGC sites. MetaSites with this namespace will be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • SHOUT_OUT - ShoutOut stand alone product. These are siteless (no actual Wix site, no HtmlWeb). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • ALBUMS - MetaSites created by the Albums product, they appear as part of the Albums app. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • WIX_STORES_TEST_DRIVE - Part of the WixStores migration flow, a user tries to migrate and gets this site to view and if the user likes it then stores removes this namespace and deletes the old site with the old stores. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • HOTELS - Hotels standalone (siteless). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • CLUBS - Clubs siteless MetaSites, a club without a wix website. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • ONBOARDING_DRAFT - A partially created ADI website. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • DEV_SITE - AppBuilder for AppStudio / shmite (c). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • LOGOS - LogoMaker websites offered to the user after logo purchase. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • VIDEO_MAKER - VideoMaker websites offered to the user after video purchase. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • PARTNER_DASHBOARD - MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • DEV_CENTER_COMPANY - MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • HTML_DRAFT - A draft created by HTML editor on open. Upon "first save" it will be moved to be of WIX domain. Meta site with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • SITELESS_BUSINESS - the user-journey for Fitness users who want to start from managing their business instead of designing their website. Will be accessible from Site List and will not have a website app. Once the user attaches a site, the site will become a regular wixsite.
  • CREATOR_ECONOMY - Belongs to "strategic products" company. Supports new product in the creator's economy space.
  • DASHBOARD_FIRST - * It is to be used in the Business First efforts.
  • ANYWHERE - * Bookings business flow with no site.
  • HEADLESS - * Namespace for Headless Backoffice with no editor
  • ACCOUNT_MASTER_CMS - * Namespace for master site that will exist in parent account that will be referenced by subaccounts The site will be used for account level CSM feature for enterprise
  • RISE - * Rise.ai Siteless account management for Gift Cards and Store Credit.
  • BRANDED_FIRST - * As part of the branded app new funnel, users now can create a meta site that will be branded app first. There's a blank site behind the scene but it's blank). The Mobile company will be the owner of this namespace.

Possible values are:
  • OTHER - A valid option, we don't expose all reasons why site might be created.
  • FROM_TEMPLATE - A meta site was created from template.
  • DUPLICATE_BY_SITE_TRANSFER - A meta site was created by copying of the transfferred meta site.
  • DUPLICATE - A copy of existing meta site.
  • OLD_SITE_TRANSFER - A meta site was created as a transfferred site (copy of the original), old flow, should die soon.
  • FLASH - deprecated A meta site was created for Flash editor.

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Determines the reset cycle of the feature usage. Possible values are:
  • NO_PERIOD
  • MILLISECOND
  • SECOND
  • MINUTE
  • HOUR
  • WEEK
  • MONTH
  • YEAR
  • DAY
